</font><font color="#00FFFF">Outside the Western Gate
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You stand outside two large towers that have been built into the city wall
and house the massive iron gates protecting the city.  Directly west of here,
the road leads out of Midgaard and into the open plains.  On the horizon to the
north, south, and west the faint outline of trees and a river that snakes
through it all can be seen.  Seeing beyond that is impossible.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Wide Way Through the Forest
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are traveling a rather wide path along the forest edge west of Midgaard.
The path is actually the remains of an old road that once carried trade to and
from the southern parts of the continent.  Few people travel this way
nowadays...  Too dangerous.  
</font><font color="#008080">[EXITS: n s ]

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Decaying Bridge
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You have reached the remains of a bridge crossing the River of Midgaard.  
From here you can look upstream toward Midgaard and see where the river emerges
from under the city wall.  The water, cold and dark, rushes through the narrow
channel created by the bridge and the large stones that have fallen from the
pilings.  The wood looks rotted and groans loudly with every step.  On the south
side of the bridge the road rises suddenly up a steep bank.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The Standing Stones
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Upon entering this outcropping of immense stones, you immediately feel a
calming energy in the air and you are at ease.  Some inner sixth sense tells you
that you are in an area of safety.  Apparently there are no other exits here,
save to the east which leads back to the stony path.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">176M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">133V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">317894X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
</font><font color="#0080FF">Room scan complete!
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">look stones
The stones are immense, almost as tall as a small building.  As you look closer
you notice some type of inscription engraved onto one of the larger stones.

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">176M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">133V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">317894X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
look inscription

                     LET IT BE KNOWN FOR ALL THOSE WHO SEEK
                     SHELTER IN THE PRESENCE OF THE SACRED
                     STANDING STONES, KNOW THEN THAT YOU ARE
                     SAFE WITHIN THEIR CONFINES, AND YOU MAY
                     BE AT PEACE WITH YOURSELF, FOR NONE ARE
                     ABLE TO HURT YOU WHILE YOU REMAIN HERE
                              IN THEIR PROTECTION!

There is a name engraved also, it reads: Chirith

</font><font color="#FFFFFF">&lt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FF0000">197H</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FF00">176M</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFF00">133V</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#00FFFF">317894X</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#808000">5905SP</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> </font><font color="#FFFFFF">&gt;</font><font color="#C0C0C0"> 
e

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Clay Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You travel upon an East-West road wide enough for the imperial legions to
ceremoniously march into the gates of Rome.  It is packed hard through heavy
use.  To the west, you eyes catch the splendors of a mighty city, while to the
north and south, well tended fields grow food to feed the enormous population of
Rome.  A small path leads off through a field to the north.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Mouth of the Valley

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Decaying Bridge
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You have reached the remains of a bridge crossing the River of Midgaard.  
From here you can look upstream toward Midgaard and see where the river emerges
from under the city wall.  The water, cold and dark, rushes through the narrow
channel created by the bridge and the large stones that have fallen from the
pilings.  The wood looks rotted and groans loudly with every step.  On the south
side of the bridge the road rises suddenly up a steep bank.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">Forest Road
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Travel on this old road is difficult.  Here and there it is partially blocked
by brambles that reach out and grab your clothing as you pass.  Deep ruts and
large stones make you stumble.  A bit further south is the river, you can hear
it from here.

</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are on a narrow path leading through the deep, dark forest.  The ancient
trees stand so close that the path disappears between the dusty roots.  To the
south a dark river flows from east to west.  The only exit appears to be west.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">The dark woods
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   You are traveling through woods that are as dark as night.  The trees above
block all light and wind.  The air is stagnant and smells of death and decay.  
The lack of sounds and other signs of life make your skin crawl and you feel
very much like turning back and heading for safer areas.  The path stops at the
bank of a black swiftly flowing river; however it leads south into the darkness
of the forest.  
A small sign is posted here.

</font><font color="#00FFFF">A Branch in the Black River
</font><font color="#C0C0C0">   Deep forests line the river as far as you can see in all directions.  The
river branches here, flowing both north and south.  You hear occasional splashes
yet you cannot see their source.  A large tower may be seen just to the west,
but it is inaccessible from here.

of the forest.
